subSections.title: Readings
Usage notes
subSections.text: In compounds, may lend meanings of either {{m|en|shell}} or {{m|en|spiral}}.

subSections.title: Derived terms
subSections.text:
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|螺階|らかい}}: a [[spiral]] [[staircase]]
* {{ja-r|螺子|らし}}: a [[screw]] (more commonly read as ''neji'')
* {{ja-r|螺旋|らせん}}: a [[spiral]]
* {{ja-r|螺鈿|らでん}}: [[mother of pearl]]
* {{ja-r|螺杯|らはい}}, {{ja-r|螺盃|らはい}}: a [[drinking]] [[cup]] made from the [[shell]] of a {{taxlink|Turbo marmoratus|species|noshow=1}} or {{vern|green turban}} snail
* {{ja-r|螺髪|らほつ}}: one of the thirty-two different appearances of [[Buddha]], shown in [[statuary]] with a [[hairstyle]] consisting of [[knobby]] [[spiral]]s of [[hair]]
* {{ja-r|螺髻|らけい}}: a [[hairstyle]] with the hair wrapped up in a [[spiral]] [[bun]] similar in shape to a [[conch]] [[shell]]; a [[high]], [[verdant]] [[mountain]]
{{der-bottom}}

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|つび}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=つび}}. Cognate with {{m|ja|粒|tr=tsubu||grain; granule, little roundish bit of something}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> May have originally been the standalone form; compare {{m|ja|神|tr=kamu|pos=bound form, only used in compounds}} and {{m|ja|神|tr=kami|pos=standalone form}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|ツブ|螺}} {{wikipedia|Whelk}} [[File:Whelks_at_a_fish_market_in_Japan.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|螺}} (''tsubu'', ''tsubi'', ''tsumi''): a variety of '''[[whelk]]s''' for sale.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|つぶ}} From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=つぶ}}. Cognate with {{m|ja|粒|tr=tsubu||grain; granule, little roundish bit of something}}.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}} May have originally been the combining form; compare {{m|ja|神|tr=kamu|pos=bound form, only used in compounds}} and {{m|ja|神|tr=kami|pos=standalone form}}.

subSections.title: Noun
Etymology 4
Etymology 5
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|にし}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=にし}}. Previously referred to any [[shellfish]] with a [[spiral]] [[shell]] (see ''ra'' above). Now refers more specifically to certain spiral shellfish. More common in compounds.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Synonyms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|螺|にな}} (see below), {{ja-r|蜷|にな}}, {{ja-r|河貝子|にな}}
